column3:
Rhm... i think this PR does not change anything.

Your PR would allow the program flow to enter the `else if (strCommand == "getaddr")` even if `if (!pfrom->fInbound)`,... but it would `return true` anyways on line 4743(https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/main.cpp#L4743). Or do i miss something?

Yes, it will exit before displaying the "unknown command" message now.
On Jun 26, 2015 11:13 PM, "Jonas Schnelli" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Rhm... i think this PR does not change anything.
> 
> Your PR would allow the program flow to enter the else if (strCommand ==
> "getaddr") even if if (!pfrom->fInbound),... but it would return true
> anyways on line 4743(
> https://github.com

Ah. Right. Wasn't aware of the `else` on L4736.

utACK.

If we are changing this code, please also log this exceptional event.

concept ACK

Meh. 

a) the message will only appear when debug=net is set
b) at least with the old code it shows that _something_ weird is happening, which is the point of verbose net logging (even though the message could be better) - after this patch it's ignored without any logging
I don't think this is enough of an improvement to merge, so going to close this.\n
@laanwj I'd consider this a bugfix rather than an improvement, since "getaddr" clearly is NOT an unknown command.\n
@rebroad The previous comments say that you are removing a line (interesting to at least some users) from the `debug.log`. Why not keep logging this with a proper message (as @jgarzik  suggests)?\n
